text: You got a husband-and-wife serial team killing couples.
Mr. Dominguez was forced to kill his wife for the promise of freedom.
They were never going to let him go.
We are this close to busting a pair of serial killers, and the judge won't issue a warrant?
Then she stuck her tongue in this jerk.
Rifkin's ear-- chances are she stuck it in Mr. Dominguez's ear, too.
Somebody got to our serials before we did.
Then get the hell out of here while I secure the room.
How long they been sitting on the house?
Oh, about the time that Judge Slater didn't sign the first warrant.
Makes you feel a little paranoid right now.
Alright, Captain. What do you wanna know?
So, you guys been here the whole time?
All units in the vicinity respond.
We met up with a couple black-and-whites.
False alarm. We came right back.
Observed no activity in the house until you guys got here.
You know we're going to need to see your guns.
Why would we off two scumbags when we know you're coming back with a warrant?
I am. I want your gun.
Here you go. Fellas, check out the back.
I don't know what that is.
Make sure you get all of it, though.
a lot of pheno-negative stains as well.
We're going to bring everything back.
If the killer went out the back door, this may be his print.
Good thing Brass had cops watching the house.
Linens and towels from the Sphere on top of the washing machine, and what I believe to be sheets from the motel inside the dryer.
Think they were being smart taking the sheets, or did they just get off sleeping on 'em?
Either way, they were sick and dangerous.
What does that say about whoever killed them?
Wh-What's the big deal? There's no humans involved.
Come on. The way I see it, somebody did us a favor.
Yeah. They're dead. Case is closed.
Hey, this isn't a favor, Bill.
Would've been a lot bigger screwup if...
if we didn't break surveillance and had an officer down four blocks away.
All right, what else did you see?
Kid in that house made us.
I can't believe Grissom pulled us off that serial murder case.
Yeah, well, let me tell you how it ends.
Whoa, this isn't half bad for college kids.
Yeah. Why live in a one-room flea bag when you can pool your resources and live like this.
Ma'am, you may want to take one of these.
You might want to wear those.
Yeah, if only the smell would.
It's like a sewer in here.
How long has he been in here?
Roommates last saw him Thursday night.
Guy goes to take a shower and DFOs.
He never got to the cold water, did he?
Roommate said only the hot water faucet was on.
Must've been a steam bath in here.
Well, any evidence on the floor's been washed away.
could be something in the tub.
We got to take that body and get it through that door.
I'm at the corner of Harmon Hill and 25th, just east of the intersection.
I think a cop got shot.
I received the call and issued the 444.
Uniforms called back a few minutes later, said they checked the area, said it was a UTL.
I'll hear it when you give me a dub of the original caller's voice...
I can get that for you right now.
If I'm not done, you're not done.
We already gave you our footprints, and our fingerprints are on file, so what else do you need?
So, Bradley, you saw our police officer at that door?
and I was watching these guys all night.
See, the two bad guys drove away in the van, and then the policeman showed up, knocked on the door.
but he never came back out.
Did you see a police car?
Ever see a beat cop anywhere but the Strip?
And how'd he beat us to the killer?
Definitely doesn't belong in the wound track.
Did your guy get shot through a window?
We found a lot of this material at the crime scene.
Maybe he was shot through some sort of object.
Well, Mr. Klinefeld was shot once in the front and Mrs. Klinefeld once in the back.
Dare I say the couple that slays together, lays together?
This drain hasn't been tampered with.
I think this is an accidental.
There's nothing but young people stuff.
Well, I don't think that means much.
Chances are he's not getting his drugs from a medicine cabinet.
Any prints would have been washed away.
Same place we were when we walked through the door-- with a bloated floater.
Hey, you know that cell phone Grissom found at the crime scene?
Traced it back to a public defender.
Made life hell for her while she was in DC.
Have you run a sample of this through the GCMS?
I got the results back from Grissom's ant puddle.
Corn syrup, glucose, caramel and water.
Where do you keep the sodium rhodizinate?
On top of the file cabinet.
You and Bobby switched or what?
Hey, Rich, whatever happened with those bullets?
Consistent with an officer's duty weapon.
Consistent with Officer Commons and Officer Nowlin's weapons?
Polyethylene plus corn syrup plus GSR gives you what?
Polyethylene and corn syrup is... cola in a bottle.
GSR on the inside of a plastic bottle means...
Only good for a couple shots.
So, that shooter was sitting on the house and the surveillance team.
Empties out his bottle of soda...
...drops the phone and takes a walk.
Who do we have around here that could find us a somewhat used soda bottle?
What does this look like to you?
What's it doing on a DB's shirt?
Some kind of greasepaint or makeup.
How do you get paint on the inside of your clothes?
Oh, what kind of guy paints his chest?
Well, it's not like you to have a one-track mind.
If the evidence points to cops, we chase cops.
Jesse Commons and Bill Nowlin were doing what I asked them to do.
They were sitting on the house.
Until you can get enough physical evidence to support a warrant.
Somebody knew we were looking at the Klinefelds.
Cops don't take the law into their own hands.
Oh, you want to hit below the belt?
You know, a lot of people had access to the Klinefelds.
Who knows, maybe CSI III Nicky Stokes opened up his mouth to another parking lot attendant.
There was an eyewitness who saw a uniform at the front door.
Oh, come on, a ten-year-old insomniac kid, hyped up on sugar, going blind on X-Box.
So, now you're discrediting your own witness?
All right, let's break it down.
You got a public defender's cell phone, no prints.
You got officers' weapons taken from the scene, not fired.
You got officers' shoe prints, not matching the evidence print.
You got three black-and-whites confirming that Commons and Nowlin responded to a 444.
Just because they weren't the shooters doesn't mean they weren't involved.
Oh, what, so it's a conspiracy? Oh, please!
You got a bogus 444 call two blocks away.
Oh, come on, you know the deal.
There's bogus calls come in every day.
Well, maybe you don't, because you're the kind of guy who goes to serve a warrant without a gun.
Well, that's a distinction that could be lost when the suspect's still inside the house.
Now I expect you to have mine.
That's not the way it works.
No. You need to see this.
Sorry I didn't find the soda bottle.
It's the biggest uniform shop in town.
I found it in a storm drain.
Two blocks west of the house.
All the new uniforms have zippers.
It's hot out-- at least a buck twenty-five.
Let's hope whoever was wearing that shirt sweats.
Roommates were unable to make a positive ID due to the accelerated decomposition, but dental records confirmed Daniel O'Hannissey.
Laceration on the forehead-- macerated, but not significant.
There's an obvious hematoma in the subdural space consistent with a subdural bleed.
Herniation of the Uncinate Process on the same side.
Doc, uh, why is his brain green?
Turns the brain into lime gelatin.
There was no water in the lungs.
He was dead before he hit the water.
So, you are looking at it-- a blow to the back of the head.
Sort of like a slow leak in a tire.
A slow leak in a tire?
Odds are Danny had no idea he was bleeding in his brain.
Then out of nowhere, he drops.
How long do you think he lived after the blow?
Well, he had to have been in the water for a couple of days to look like this.
So I guess we start there and we work backwards.
I lost my badge years ago.
Filed a report. Got issued a new one.
Yeah, I'm aware of officers losing their badges.
Then we don't have a problem, do we?
No, we got a problem 'cause your badge was found in the proximity of a crime scene.
How'd you manage to lose your badge?
That's not the answer I was hoping for.
I've been looking at your jacket.
You got a lot of entries in here.
You got some stick therapy. What's up with this?
Show me a cop without a few entries in his jacket, I'll show you a pogue.
Guys like you get to sit on your ass behind a desk because guys like me are out there doing the real work.
Okay, tough guy, tell me what you know.
I lost my badge. End of story.
If I ever find the guy who stole it, believe...
You went for a bottle and found a shirt?
This swab is your new priority.
I was just filling Nick in...
Uh, I was just getting started.
I can do them both together.
How can you be doing that when you're standing here?
I'm at the corner of Harmon Hill and 25th.
I think a cop got shot.
I think a cop got shot.
I have never heard a citizen that calm.
Did you get a name off that badge?
You know, Daniel was from Green Bay.
He tried to walk-on here, but, uh...
But, hey, come game night, he was always at the stadium.
He watched one game at home and lost all of his chill privileges.
Busted the couch, jumping on it.
Neighbors called the cops 'cause he was so loud.
He's the kind of guy that keeps a place like this in business.
When was the last time you saw him?
When was the last Rebel game?
He was so pumped that him and some of his buddies got into it with some other guys.
Wh-What do you mean? He started a fight?
No, Shirley Temple started the fight.
Drinks for the guys down there.
Hey, Wayne, those are for you, buddy.
Those are for you and your boys.
They scrap until someone gets a touchdown.
Do you see any of those guys in here now?
There's a couple of Shirleys over there by the big screen.
Jen, I need a sample of Fromansky's voice.
Officer in pursuit of late-model Honda Civic.
Now, I've got three full minutes of Officer Fromansky here.
I was thinking of maybe taking it to the Dispatch Convention.
I can make that dub for you.
You're a suspect in an ongoing investigation.
We're not allowed to have a conversation.
Let me tell you something, you arrogant clod.
Wouldn't waste my life on them.
Well, if that's true, then your DNA sample will rule you out.
Someday, you're going to need me or my buddies at a scene...
and wouldn't you know it-- we all hit traffic on the way.
Is that how you do your job, Officer?
Officer in pursuit of late-model Honda Civic...
Pitch, speed, volume-- they're all different.
Fromansky didn't make that call, Gris.
The, uh, sweat from the uniform not a match to Officer Fromansky.
You're a hard guy to find.
I got ahead of the evidence.
I made it personal, and I don't know why.
We both got a little stubborn.
You were like your old self there.
I still think it's somebody inside.
Pull off a murder like this, it takes some practice.
About six or seven months ago, we arrested a couple of gang-bangers.
They were popping blackjack dealers on their way home from work, taking their toke envelopes.
Because of some technicality, Judge Slater let them walk right out of the courtroom.
I mean, they were talking about this in the precinct for weeks.
Now this morality play has a very quick and unhappy ending.
But still, I don't like a cop for this.
That's what he probably told himself.
Like I told you before, if you're here for a warrant, you better have evidence to back it up.
We're not here to get a warrant, Judge.
Wayne, you want to tell us about the game Friday night?
You mean like strategy? Chalk talk?
Start with the Shirley Temples and go from there.
You're talking about those idiots from UNLV.
We have a witness that said you guys had a beef.
Dude, I don't even know those guys, okay?
They came in, they tried to be funny, and we set them straight.
Gave them a little talking to.
Did that punk bitch rat us out?
Hey, that guy left before we did, and he was fine.
He was still running his mouth.
I suppose your buddies will testify to that?
Look, you can ask anybody who was in there.
You want to borrow my ring?
You're not under arrest. You're free to go.
You have a lot of nerve walking in my chambers accusing me of murder.
I'm not accusing you of murder.
I just want to see your shoes.
You've a warrant to search my closet? We need to see all your shoes.
That goes for your bailiff and your clerk as well.
I'm sure you'd want to set an example for all court employees.
The warrant is limited to me, my clerk and the bailiff?
The Klinefeld warrant was generated from this office, and only you three had access to their personal information, so... yeah.
I look forward to the day you return to my courtroom, Detective.
Always count on him for paper.
What tipped you to the ring?
No, it was in Steven Spielberg's Jaws.
They had this mechanical shark named Bruce.
And he kept swimming round and round in circles.
How did Bruce's fin get bent?
Same way the kid's ring did.
You got to be kidding me.
Look, I told you, that guy walked away.
This is Detective Jim Brass, Las Vegas Police Department.
I'm with Stuart Gardner, County Court Clerk.
And spell it for the record.
That's right. You used to be a cop.
Once a cop, always a cop.
I have a warrant to search these premises.
This is crap. You can't arrest me.
I'm not here to arrest you.
We also found your old uniform shirt, with your DNA on the collar.
What are you going to retire on?
Ah, you want to talk about me, huh?
You're a clerk. Get your facts straight.
He was a passenger in a felony pursuit.
So how'd you get promoted to Captain after that?
Must be my good looks. You agreed to drive a desk...
at CSI... with all the sleazy civilians.
They put a lot of bad guys away.
You know, I'm going to give you a little therapy for free.
You know, if you had only shown a little restraint, they would have processed the DNA after Klinefelds'.
Lots of guys get off on slam-dunk cases.
Yeah, I bet you saw a lot of that working for Judge Slater, most liberal judge in the state.
Bet you saw a lot of good cases go south, while you just processed those release forms, huh?
Doesn't it piss you off to put all your hard work in the hands of 12 people too stupid to get off jury duty?
This guy's a nut job vigilante.
He's making the whole department look bad.
I guess he'd just figured he'd take a shortcut.
